returns the current day as a value from 1 - 31.
classitems.name: day
example: var day = day(); text("Current day: \n"+day, 5, 50);

classitems.description:
p5.js communicates with the clock on your computer. The hour() function
returns the current hour as a value from 0 - 23.
classitems.name: hour
example: var hour = hour(); text("Current hour:\n"+hour, 5, 50);

classitems.description:
p5.js communicates with the clock on your computer. The minute() function
returns the current minute as a value from 0 - 59.
classitems.name: minute
example: var minute = minute(); text("Current minute: \n:"+minute, 5, 50);

classitems.description:
Returns the number of milliseconds (thousandths of a second) since
starting the program. This information is often used for timing events and
animation sequences.
classitems.name: millis

return.description: the number of milliseconds since starting the program

example: var millisecond = millis(); text("Milliseconds \nrunning: "+millisecond, 5, 50);

classitems.description:
p5.js communicates with the clock on your computer. The month() function
returns the current month as a value from 1 - 12.
classitems.name: month
example: var month = month(); text("Current month: \n"+month, 5, 50);

classitems.description:
p5.js communicates with the clock on your computer. The second() function
returns the current second as a value from 0 - 59.
classitems.name: second
example: var second = second(); text("Current second: \n" +second, 5, 50);

classitems.description:
p5.js communicates with the clock on your computer. The year() function
returns the current year as an integer (2014, 2015, 2016, etc).
classitems.name: year
example: var year = year(); text("Current year: \n" +year, 5, 50);

classitems.description:
_globalInit

TODO: ???
if sketch is on window
assume "global" mode
and instantiate p5 automatically
otherwise do nothing

Searches the page for an element with given ID and returns it as
a p5.Element. The DOM node itself can be accessed with .elt.
Returns null if none found.
classitems.name: getElement

params.name: id
params.description: id of element to search for

classitems.description:
Searches the page for elements with given class and returns an
array of p5.Elements. The DOM nodes themselves can be accessed
with .elt. Returns an empty array if none found.
classitems.name: getElements

params.name: class
params.description: class name of elements to search for

return.description: array of p5.Element wrapped nodes found

classitems.description: Helper function for getElement and getElements.

Removes all elements created by p5, except any canvas / graphics
elements created by createCanvas or createGraphics.
Event handlers are removed, and element is removed from the DOM.
classitems.name: removeElements
example: function setup() { createCanvas(100, 100); createDiv('this is some text'); createP('this is a paragraph'); } function mousePressed() { removeElements(); // this will remove the div and p, not canvas }

classitems.description: Helpers for create methods.

Creates a <div></div> element in the DOM with given inner HTML.
Appends to the container node if one is specified, otherwise
appends to body.
classitems.name: createDiv

return.description:
pointer to p5.Element holding created
                          node

classitems.description:
Creates a <p></p> element in the DOM with given inner HTML. Used
for paragraph length text.
Appends to the container node if one is specified, otherwise
appends to body.
classitems.name: createP

return.description:
pointer to p5.Element holding created
                          node

classitems.description:
Creates a <span></span> element in the DOM with given inner HTML.
Appends to the container node if one is specified, otherwise
appends to body.
classitems.name: createSpan

return.description:
pointer to p5.Element holding created
                          node

classitems.description:
Creates an <img /> element in the DOM with given src and
alternate text.
Appends to the container node if one is specified, otherwise
appends to body.
classitems.name: createImg

params.name: src
params.description: src path or url for image

params.name: alt
params.description:
alternate text to be used if image does not
                 load

return.description:
pointer to p5.Element holding created
                          node

classitems.description:
Creates an <a></a> element in the DOM for including a hyperlink.
Appends to the container node if one is specified, otherwise
appends to body.
classitems.name: createA

params.name: href
params.description: url of page to link to

params.name: html
params.description: inner html of link element to display

params.name: target
params.description:
target where new link should open,
                            could be _blank, _self, _parent, _top.

return.description:
pointer to p5.Element holding created
                          node

classitems.description:
Creates a slider <input></input> element in the DOM.
Use .size() to set the display length of the slider.
Appends to the container node if one is specified, otherwise
appends to body.
classitems.name: createSlider

return.description:
pointer to p5.Element holding created
                          node

classitems.description:
Creates a <button></button> element in the DOM.
Use .size() to set the display size of the button.
Use .mousePressed() to specify behavior on press.
Appends to the container node if one is specified, otherwise
appends to body.
classitems.name: createButton

return.description:
pointer to p5.Element holding created
                          node

classitems.description:
Creates an <input></input> element in the DOM for text input.
Use .size() to set the display length of the box.
Appends to the container node if one is specified, otherwise
appends to body.
classitems.name: createInput

params.name: value
params.description: default value of the input box

return.description:
pointer to p5.Element holding created
                          node

classitems.description:
Creates an <input></input> element in the DOM of type 'file'.  
This allows users to select local files for use in a sketch.
classitems.name: createFileInput

params.name: callback
params.description: callback function for when a file loaded

params.name: multiple
params.description: optional to allow multiple files selected

return.description: pointer to p5.Element holding created DOM element

classitems.description:
Creates an HTML5 <video> element in the DOM for simple playback
of audio/video. Shown by default, can be hidden with .hide()
and drawn into canvas using video(). Appends to the container
node if one is specified, otherwise appends to body. The first parameter
can be either a single string path to a video file, or an array of string
paths to different formats of the same video. This is useful for ensuring
that your video can play across different browsers, as each supports
different formats. See <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Supported_media_formats">this
page for further information about supported formats.
classitems.name: createVideo

params.name: src
params.description:
path to a video file, or array of paths for
                            supporting different browsers

params.name: callback
params.description:
callback function to be called upon
                            'canplaythrough' event fire, that is, when the
                            browser can play the media, and estimates that
                            enough data has been loaded to play the media
                            up to its end without having to stop for
                            further buffering of content

classitems.description:
Creates a hidden HTML5 <audio> element in the DOM for simple audio
playback. Appends to the container node if one is specified,
otherwise appends to body. The first parameter
can be either a single string path to a audio file, or an array of string
paths to different formats of the same audio. This is useful for ensuring
that your audio can play across different browsers, as each supports
different formats. See <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Supported_media_formats">this
page for further information about supported formats.
classitems.name: createAudio

params.name: src
params.description:
path to an audio file, or array of paths for
                            supporting different browsers

params.name: callback
params.description:
callback function to be called upon
                            'canplaythrough' event fire, that is, when the
                            browser can play the media, and estimates that
                            enough data has been loaded to play the media
                            up to its end without having to stop for
                            further buffering of content

classitems.description: Creates a new <video> element that contains the audio/video feed from a webcam. This can be drawn onto the canvas using video(). More specific properties of the stream can be passing in a Constraints object. See the W3C spec for possible properties. Note that not all of these are supported by all browsers.
classitems.name: createCapture

params.name: type
params.description:
type of capture, either VIDEO or
                                   AUDIO if none specified, default both,
                                   or a Constraints boject

params.name: callback
params.description:
function to be called once
                                   stream has loaded

example:
var capture; function setup() { createCanvas(480, 120); capture = createCapture(VIDEO); } function draw() { image(capture, 0, 0, width, width*capture.height/capture.width); filter(INVERT); }
function setup() { createCanvas(480, 120); var constraints = { video: { mandatory: { minWidth: 1280, minHeight: 720 }, optional: [ { maxFrameRate: 10 } ] }, audio: true }; createCapture(constraints, function(stream) { console.log(stream); }); }

classitems.description:
Creates element with given tag in the DOM with given content.
Appends to the container node if one is specified, otherwise
appends to body.
classitems.name: createElement

params.name: content
params.description: html content to be inserted into the element

return.description:
pointer to p5.Element holding created
                          node

classitems.description: Adds specified class to the element.
classitems.name: addClass

classitems.description: Removes specified class from the element.
classitems.name: removeClass

classitems.description:
Attaches the element  as a child to the parent specified.
 Accepts either a string ID, DOM node, or p5.Element
classitems.name: child

params.name: child
params.description:
the ID, DOM node, or p5.Element
                         to add to the current element

example:
var div0 = createDiv('this is the parent'); var div1 = createDiv('this is the child'); div0.child(div1); // use p5.Element
var div0 = createDiv('this is the parent'); var div1 = createDiv('this is the child'); div1.id('apples'); div0.child('apples'); // use id
var div0 = createDiv('this is the parent'); var elt = document.getElementById('myChildDiv'); div0.child(elt); // use element from page

classitems.description:
If an argument is given, sets the inner HTML of the element,
 replacing any existing html. If no arguments are given, returns
 the inner HTML of the element.
classitems.name: html

params.name: html
params.description: the HTML to be placed inside the element

classitems.description:
Sets the position of the element relative to (0, 0) of the
 window. Essentially, sets position:absolute and left and top
 properties of style.
classitems.name: position

params.name: x
params.description: x-position relative to upper left of window

params.name: y
params.description: y-position relative to upper left of window

example: function setup() { var cnv = createCanvas(100, 100); background(0); // positions canvas 50px to right and 100px // below upper left corner of the window cnv.position(50, 100); }

classitems.description:
Sets the given style (css) property of the element with the given value.
 If no value is specified, returns the value of the given property,
 or undefined if the property is not.
classitems.name: style

return.description:
value of property, if no value is specified
                             or p5.Element

example: var myDiv = createDiv("I like pandas."); myDiv.style("color", "#ff0000"); myDiv.style("font-size", "18px");

classitems.description:
Adds a new attribute or changes the value of an existing attribute
 on the specified element. If no value is specified, returns the
 value of the given attribute, or null if attribute is not set.
classitems.name: attribute

return.description:
value of attribute, if no value is
                             specified or p5.Element

example: var myDiv = createDiv("I like pandas."); myDiv.attribute("align", "center");

classitems.description:
Either returns the value of the element if no arguments
given, or sets the value of the element.
classitems.name: value

return.description:
value of element, if no value is
                            specified or p5.Element

classitems.description: Shows the current element. Essentially, setting display:block for the style.
classitems.name: show

classitems.description: Hides the current element. Essentially, setting display:none for the style.
classitems.name: hide

classitems.description:
Sets the width and height of the element. AUTO can be used to
 only adjust one dimension.
classitems.name: size

classitems.description: Removes the element and deregisters all listeners.
classitems.name: remove
example: var myDiv = createDiv('this is some text'); myDiv.remove();

classitems.description: Play an HTML5 media element.
classitems.name: play

classitems.description: Stops an HTML5 media element (sets current time to zero).
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description: Pauses an HTML5 media element.
classitems.name: pause

classitems.description: Set 'loop' to true for an HTML5 media element, and starts playing.
classitems.name: loop

classitems.description:
Set 'loop' to false for an HTML5 media element. Element will stop
when it reaches the end.
classitems.name: noLoop

classitems.description: Set HTML5 media element to autoplay or not.
classitems.name: autoplay

classitems.description:
Sets volume for this HTML5 media element. If no argument is given,
returns the current volume.
classitems.name: volume

classitems.description:
If no arguments are given, returns the current time of the elmeent.
If an argument is given the current time of the element is set to it.
classitems.name: time

classitems.description: Returns the duration of the HTML5 media element.
classitems.name: duration

classitems.description:
Send the audio output of this element to a specified audioNode or
p5.sound object. If no element is provided, connects to p5's master
output. That connection is established when this method is first called.
All connections are removed by the .disconnect() method.

This method is meant to be used with the p5.sound.js addon library.
classitems.name: connect

params.name: audioNode
params.description:
AudioNode from the Web
                                    Audio API, or an object from the
                                    p5.sound library

classitems.description:
Disconnect all Web Audio routing, including to master output.
This is useful if you want to re-route the output through
audio effects, for example.
classitems.name: disconnect

classitems.description: Show the default MediaElement controls, as determined by the web browser.
classitems.name: showControls

classitems.description: Hide the default mediaElement controls.
classitems.name: hideControls

classitems.description:
Schedule events to trigger every time a MediaElement
(audio/video) reaches a playback cue point.

Accepts a callback function, a time (in seconds) at which to trigger
the callback, and an optional parameter for the callback.

Time will be passed as the first parameter to the callback function,
and param will be the second parameter.
classitems.name: addCue

params.name: time
params.description:
Time in seconds, relative to this media
                           element's playback. For example, to trigger
                           an event every time playback reaches two
                           seconds, pass in the number 2. This will be
                           passed as the first parameter to
                           the callback function.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Name of a function that will be
                           called at the given time. The callback will
                           receive time and (optionally) param as its
                           two parameters.

params.name: value
params.description:
An object to be passed as the
                           second parameter to the
                           callback function.

return.description:
id ID of this cue,
                    useful for removeCue(id)

example: function setup() { background(255,255,255); audioEl = createAudio('assets/beat.mp3'); audioEl.showControls(); // schedule three calls to changeBackground audioEl.addCue(0.5, changeBackground, color(255,0,0) ); audioEl.addCue(1.0, changeBackground, color(0,255,0) ); audioEl.addCue(2.5, changeBackground, color(0,0,255) ); audioEl.addCue(3.0, changeBackground, color(0,255,255) ); audioEl.addCue(4.2, changeBackground, color(255,255,0) ); audioEl.addCue(5.0, changeBackground, color(255,255,0) ); } function changeBackground(val) { background(val); }

classitems.description:
Remove a callback based on its ID. The ID is returned by the
addCue method.
classitems.name: removeCue

params.name: id
params.description: ID of the cue, as returned by addCue

classitems.description:
Remove all of the callbacks that had originally been scheduled
via the addCue method.
classitems.name: clearCues

classitems.description: Underlying File object. All normal File methods can be called on this.
classitems.name: file

classitems.description: File type (image, text, etc.)
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: File subtype (usually the file extension jpg, png, xml, etc.)
classitems.name: subtype

classitems.description: File name
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: File size
classitems.name: size

Web Audio SHIMS and helper functions to ensure compatability across browsers
Returns the Audio Context for this sketch. Useful for users who would like to dig deeper into the Web Audio API .
classitems.name: getAudioContext

classitems.description:
Determine which filetypes are supported (inspired by buzz.js)
The audio element (el) will only be used to test browser support for various audio formats
Master contains AudioContext and the master sound output.

Returns a number representing the master amplitude (volume) for sound 
in this sketch.
classitems.name: getMasterVolume

return.description:
Master amplitude (volume) for sound in this sketch.
                 Should be between 0.0 (silence) and 1.0.

classitems.description:
Scale the output of all sound in this sketch

Scaled between 0.0 (silence) and 1.0 (full volume). 1.0 is the maximum amplitude of a digital sound, so multiplying by greater than 1.0 may cause digital distortion. To fade, provide a rampTime parameter. For more complex fades, see the Env class. Alternately, you can pass in a signal source such as an oscillator to modulate the amplitude with an audio signal.

How This Works: When you load the p5.sound module, it creates a single instance of p5sound. All sound objects in this module output to p5sound before reaching your computer's output. So if you change the amplitude of p5sound, it impacts all of the sound in this module.

If no value is provided, returns a Web Audio API Gain Node
classitems.name: masterVolume

params.name: volume
params.description:
Volume (amplitude) between 0.0
                                   and 1.0 or modulating signal/oscillator

params.name: timeFromNow
params.description:
Schedule this event to happen at
                               t seconds in the future

classitems.description: p5.soundOut is the p5.sound master output. It sends output to the destination of this window's web audio context. It contains Web Audio API nodes including a dyanmicsCompressor (.limiter), and Gain Nodes for .input and .output.
classitems.name: p5.soundOut

classitems.description:
a silent connection to the DesinationNode
which will ensure that anything connected to it
will not be garbage collected

Returns a number representing the sample rate, in samples per second,
of all sound objects in this audio context. It is determined by the
sampling rate of your operating system's sound card, and it is not
currently possile to change.
It is often 44100, or twice the range of human hearing.
classitems.name: sampleRate

classitems.description:
Returns the closest MIDI note value for
a given frequency.

params.name: frequency
params.description:
A freqeuncy, for example, the "A"
                           above Middle C is 440Hz

classitems.description:
Returns the frequency value of a MIDI note value.
General MIDI treats notes as integers where middle C
is 60, C# is 61, D is 62 etc. Useful for generating
musical frequencies with oscillators.
classitems.name: midiToFreq

params.name: midiNote
params.description: The number of a MIDI note

return.description: Frequency value of the given MIDI note

example: var notes = [60, 64, 67, 72]; var i = 0; function setup() { osc = new p5.Oscillator('Triangle'); osc.start(); frameRate(1); } function draw() { var freq = midiToFreq(notes[i]); osc.freq(freq); i++; if (i >= notes.length){ i = 0; } }

classitems.description: List the SoundFile formats that you will include. LoadSound will search your directory for these extensions, and will pick a format that is compatable with the client's web browser. Here is a free online file converter.
classitems.name: soundFormats
example: function preload() { // set the global sound formats soundFormats('mp3', 'ogg'); // load either beatbox.mp3, or .ogg, depending on browser mySound = loadSound('../sounds/beatbox.mp3'); } function setup() { mySound.play(); }

classitems.description: Used by Osc and Env to chain signal math

loadSound() returns a new p5.SoundFile from a specified path. If called during preload(), the p5.SoundFile will be ready to play in time for setup() and draw(). If called outside of preload, the p5.SoundFile will not be ready immediately, so loadSound accepts a callback as the second parameter. Using a local server is recommended when loading external files.
classitems.name: loadSound

params.name: path
params.description:
Path to the sound file, or an array with
                                  paths to soundfiles in multiple formats
                                  i.e. ['sound.ogg', 'sound.mp3'].
                                  Alternately, accepts an object: either
                                  from the HTML5 File API, or a p5.File.

params.name: callback
params.description: Name of a function to call once file loads

params.name: callback
params.description:
Name of a function to call while file is loading.
                               This function will receive a percentage from 0.0
                               to 1.0.

example: function preload() { mySound = loadSound('assets/doorbell.mp3'); } function setup() { mySound.setVolume(0.1); mySound.play(); }

classitems.description:
This is a helper function that the p5.SoundFile calls to load
itself. Accepts a callback (the name of another function)
as an optional parameter.

params.name: callback
params.description: Name of a function to call once file loads

classitems.description: Returns true if the sound file finished loading successfully.
classitems.name: isLoaded

classitems.description: Play the p5.SoundFile
classitems.name: play

params.name: startTime
params.description: (optional) schedule playback to start (in seconds from now).

classitems.description: p5.SoundFile has two play modes: restart and sustain. Play Mode determines what happens to a p5.SoundFile if it is triggered while in the middle of playback. In sustain mode, playback will continue simultaneous to the new playback. In restart mode, play() will stop playback and start over. Sustain is the default mode.
classitems.name: playMode
example: function setup(){ mySound = loadSound('assets/Damscray_DancingTiger.mp3'); } function mouseClicked() { mySound.playMode('sustain'); mySound.play(); } function keyPressed() { mySound.playMode('restart'); mySound.play(); }

classitems.description:
Pauses a file that is currently playing. If the file is not
playing, then nothing will happen.

After pausing, .play() will resume from the paused
position.
If p5.SoundFile had been set to loop before it was paused,
it will continue to loop after it is unpaused with .play().
classitems.name: pause

params.name: startTime
params.description:
(optional) schedule event to occur
                             seconds from now

example: var soundFile; function preload() { soundFormats('ogg', 'mp3'); soundFile = loadSound('assets/Damscray_-_Dancing_Tiger_02.mp3'); } function setup() { background(0, 255, 0); soundFile.setVolume(0.1); soundFile.loop(); } function keyTyped() { if (key == 'p') { soundFile.pause(); background(255, 0, 0); } } function keyReleased() { if (key == 'p') { soundFile.play(); background(0, 255, 0); }

classitems.description:
Loop the p5.SoundFile. Accepts optional parameters to set the
playback rate, playback volume, loopStart, loopEnd.
classitems.name: loop

params.name: startTime
params.description:
(optional) schedule event to occur
                            seconds from now

classitems.description:
Set a p5.SoundFile's looping flag to true or false. If the sound
is currently playing, this change will take effect when it
reaches the end of the current playback.

params.name: Boolean
params.description: set looping to true or false

classitems.description: Returns 'true' if a p5.SoundFile is currently looping and playing, 'false' if not.

Returns true if a p5.SoundFile is playing, false if not (i.e.
paused or stopped).
classitems.name: isPlaying

classitems.description:
Returns true if a p5.SoundFile is paused, false if not (i.e.
playing or stopped).
classitems.name: isPaused

classitems.description: Stop soundfile playback.
classitems.name: stop

params.name: startTime
params.description:
(optional) schedule event to occur
                            in seconds from now

classitems.description: Stop playback on all of this soundfile's sources.

Multiply the output volume (amplitude) of a sound file between 0.0 (silence) and 1.0 (full volume). 1.0 is the maximum amplitude of a digital sound, so multiplying by greater than 1.0 may cause digital distortion. To fade, provide a rampTime parameter. For more complex fades, see the Env class. Alternately, you can pass in a signal source such as an oscillator to modulate the amplitude with an audio signal.
classitems.name: setVolume

params.name: volume
params.description:
Volume (amplitude) between 0.0
                                   and 1.0 or modulating signal/oscillator

params.name: timeFromNow
params.description:
Schedule this event to happen at

classitems.description:
Set the stereo panning of a p5.sound object to
a floating point number between -1.0 (left) and 1.0 (right).
Default is 0.0 (center).
classitems.name: pan

params.name: timeFromNow
params.description:
schedule this event to happen
                               seconds from now

example: var ball = {}; var soundFile; function setup() { soundFormats('ogg', 'mp3'); soundFile = loadSound('assets/beatbox.mp3'); } function draw() { background(0); ball.x = constrain(mouseX, 0, width); ellipse(ball.x, height/2, 20, 20) } function mousePressed(){ // map the ball's x location to a panning degree // between -1.0 (left) and 1.0 (right) var panning = map(ball.x, 0., width,-1.0, 1.0); soundFile.pan(panning); soundFile.play(); }

classitems.description: Returns the current stereo pan position (-1.0 to 1.0)

return.description:
Returns the stereo pan setting of the Oscillator
                         as a number between -1.0 (left) and 1.0 (right).
                         0.0 is center and default.

classitems.description:
Set the playback rate of a sound file. Will change the speed and the pitch.
Values less than zero will reverse the audio buffer.
classitems.name: rate

params.name: playbackRate
params.description:
Set the playback rate. 1.0 is normal,
                                   .5 is half-speed, 2.0 is twice as fast.
                                   Must be greater than zero.

example: var song; function preload() { song = loadSound('assets/Damscray_DancingTiger.mp3'); } function setup() { song.loop(); } function draw() { background(200); // Set the rate to a range between 0.1 and 4 // Changing the rate also alters the pitch var speed = map(mouseY, 0.1, height, 0, 2); speed = constrain(speed, 0.01, 4); song.rate(speed); // Draw a circle to show what is going on stroke(0); fill(51, 100); ellipse(mouseX, 100, 48, 48); }

classitems.description: Returns the duration of a sound file in seconds.
classitems.name: duration

return.description: The duration of the soundFile in seconds.

classitems.description:
Return the current position of the p5.SoundFile playhead, in seconds.
Note that if you change the playbackRate while the p5.SoundFile is
playing, the results may not be accurate.
classitems.name: currentTime

return.description: currentTime of the soundFile in seconds.

classitems.description:
Move the playhead of the song to a position, in seconds. Start
and Stop time. If none are given, will reset the file to play
entire duration from start to finish.
classitems.name: jump

params.name: cueTime
params.description: cueTime of the soundFile in seconds.

classitems.description:
Return the number of channels in a sound file.
For example, Mono = 1, Stereo = 2.
classitems.name: channels

classitems.description: Return the sample rate of the sound file.
classitems.name: sampleRate

classitems.description:
Return the number of samples in a sound file.
Equal to sampleRate * duration.
classitems.name: frames

classitems.description:
Returns an array of amplitude peaks in a p5.SoundFile that can be
used to draw a static waveform. Scans through the p5.SoundFile's
audio buffer to find the greatest amplitudes. Accepts one
parameter, 'length', which determines size of the array.
Larger arrays result in more precise waveform visualizations.

Inspired by Wavesurfer.js.
classitems.name: getPeaks

params.name: length
params.description:
length is the size of the returned array.
                         Larger length results in more precision.
                         Defaults to 5*width of the browser window.

classitems.description:
Reverses the p5.SoundFile's buffer source.
Playback must be handled separately (see example).
classitems.name: reverseBuffer
example: var drum; function preload() { drum = loadSound('assets/drum.mp3'); } function setup() { drum.reverseBuffer(); drum.play(); }

classitems.description:
Connects the output of a p5sound object to input of another
p5.sound object. For example, you may connect a p5.SoundFile to an
FFT or an Effect. If no parameter is given, it will connect to
the master output. Most p5sound objects connect to the master
output when they are created.
classitems.name: connect

params.name: object
params.description: Audio object that accepts an input

classitems.description: Disconnects the output of this p5sound object.
classitems.name: disconnect

classitems.description:
Read the Amplitude (volume level) of a p5.SoundFile. The
p5.SoundFile class contains its own instance of the Amplitude
class to help make it easy to get a SoundFile's volume level.
Accepts an optional smoothing value (0.0 < 1.0).
classitems.name: getLevel

params.name: smoothing
params.description:
Smoothing is 0.0 by default.
                             Smooths values based on previous values.

classitems.description:
Reset the source for this SoundFile to a
new path (URL).
classitems.name: setPath

classitems.description: Replace the current Audio Buffer with a new Buffer.

params.name: buf
params.description:
Array of Float32 Array(s). 2 Float32 Arrays
                   will create a stereo source. 1 will create
                   a mono source.

classitems.description:
processPeaks returns an array of timestamps where it thinks there is a beat.

This is an asynchronous function that processes the soundfile in an offline audio context,
and sends the results to your callback function.

The process involves running the soundfile through a lowpass filter, and finding all of the
peaks above the initial threshold. If the total number of peaks are below the minimum number of peaks,
it decreases the threshold and re-runs the analysis until either minPeaks or minThreshold are reached.
classitems.name: processPeaks

params.name: callback
params.description: a function to call once this data is returned

params.name: minPeaks
params.description: minimum number of peaks defaults to 200

classitems.description:
Schedule events to trigger every time a MediaElement
(audio/video) reaches a playback cue point.

Accepts a callback function, a time (in seconds) at which to trigger
the callback, and an optional parameter for the callback.

Time will be passed as the first parameter to the callback function,
and param will be the second parameter.
classitems.name: addCue

params.name: time
params.description:
Time in seconds, relative to this media
                           element's playback. For example, to trigger
                           an event every time playback reaches two
                           seconds, pass in the number 2. This will be
                           passed as the first parameter to
                           the callback function.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Name of a function that will be
                           called at the given time. The callback will
                           receive time and (optionally) param as its
                           two parameters.

params.name: value
params.description:
An object to be passed as the
                           second parameter to the
                           callback function.

return.description:
id ID of this cue,
                    useful for removeCue(id)

example: function setup() { background(0); noStroke(); fill(255); textAlign(CENTER); text('click to play', width/2, height/2); mySound = loadSound('assets/beat.mp3'); // schedule calls to changeText mySound.addCue(0.50, changeText, "hello" ); mySound.addCue(1.00, changeText, "p5" ); mySound.addCue(1.50, changeText, "what" ); mySound.addCue(2.00, changeText, "do" ); mySound.addCue(2.50, changeText, "you" ); mySound.addCue(3.00, changeText, "want" ); mySound.addCue(4.00, changeText, "to" ); mySound.addCue(5.00, changeText, "make" ); mySound.addCue(6.00, changeText, "?" ); } function changeText(val) { background(0); text(val, width/2, height/2); } function mouseClicked() { if (mouseX > 0 && mouseX < width && mouseY > 0 && mouseY < height) { if (mySound.isPlaying() ) { mySound.stop(); } else { mySound.play(); } } }

classitems.description:
Remove a callback based on its ID. The ID is returned by the
addCue method.
classitems.name: removeCue

params.name: id
params.description: ID of the cue, as returned by addCue

classitems.description:
Remove all of the callbacks that had originally been scheduled
via the addCue method.
classitems.name: clearCues

classitems.description:
Connects to the p5sound instance (master output) by default.
Optionally, you can pass in a specific source (i.e. a soundfile).
classitems.name: setInput

params.name: snd
params.description:
set the sound source
                                     (optional, defaults to
                                     master output)

params.name: smoothing
params.description:
a range between 0.0 and 1.0
                                      to smooth amplitude readings

example: function preload(){ sound1 = loadSound('assets/beat.mp3'); sound2 = loadSound('assets/drum.mp3'); } function setup(){ amplitude = new p5.Amplitude(); sound1.play(); sound2.play(); amplitude.setInput(sound2); } function draw() { background(0); fill(255); var level = amplitude.getLevel(); var size = map(level, 0, 1, 0, 200); ellipse(width/2, height/2, size, size); } function mouseClicked(){ sound1.stop(); sound2.stop(); }

classitems.description:
Returns a single Amplitude reading at the moment it is called.
For continuous readings, run in the draw loop.
classitems.name: getLevel

return.description: Amplitude as a number between 0.0 and 1.0

example: function preload(){ sound = loadSound('assets/beat.mp3'); } function setup() { amplitude = new p5.Amplitude(); sound.play(); } function draw() { background(0); fill(255); var level = amplitude.getLevel(); var size = map(level, 0, 1, 0, 200); ellipse(width/2, height/2, size, size); } function mouseClicked(){ sound.stop(); }

classitems.description:
Determines whether the results of Amplitude.process() will be
Normalized. To normalize, Amplitude finds the difference the
loudest reading it has processed and the maximum amplitude of
1.0. Amplitude adds this difference to all values to produce
results that will reliably map between 0.0 and 1.0. However,
if a louder moment occurs, the amount that Normalize adds to
all the values will change. Accepts an optional boolean parameter
(true or false). Normalizing is off by default.
classitems.name: toggleNormalize

params.name: boolean
params.description: set normalize to true (1) or false (0)

classitems.description:
Smooth Amplitude analysis by averaging with the last analysis 
frame. Off by default.
classitems.name: smooth

classitems.description:
Set the input source for the FFT analysis. If no source is
provided, FFT will analyze all sound in the sketch.
classitems.name: setInput

params.name: source
params.description: p5.sound object (or web audio API source node)

classitems.description:
Returns an array of amplitude values (between -1.0 and +1.0) that represent
a snapshot of amplitude readings in a single buffer. Length will be
equal to bins (defaults to 1024). Can be used to draw the waveform
of a sound.
classitems.name: waveform

params.name: bins
params.description:
Must be a power of two between
                          16 and 1024. Defaults to 1024.

params.name: precision
params.description:
If any value is provided, will return results
                            in a Float32 Array which is more precise
                            than a regular array.

return.description:
Array    Array of amplitude values (-1 to 1)
                          over time. Array length = bins.

classitems.description: Returns an array of amplitude values (between 0 and 255) across the frequency spectrum. Length is equal to FFT bins (1024 by default). The array indices correspond to frequencies (i.e. pitches), from the lowest to the highest that humans can hear. Each value represents amplitude at that slice of the frequency spectrum. Must be called prior to using getEnergy().
classitems.name: analyze

params.name: bins
params.description:
Must be a power of two between
                           16 and 1024. Defaults to 1024.

params.name: scale
params.description:
If "dB," returns decibel
                           float measurements between
                           -140 and 0 (max).
                           Otherwise returns integers from 0-255.

return.description:
spectrum    Array of energy (amplitude/volume)
                            values across the frequency spectrum.
                            Lowest energy (silence) = 0, highest
                            possible is 255.

example: var osc; var fft; function setup(){ createCanvas(100,100); osc = new p5.Oscillator(); osc.amp(0); osc.start(); fft = new p5.FFT(); } function draw(){ background(0); var freq = map(mouseX, 0, 800, 20, 15000); freq = constrain(freq, 1, 20000); osc.freq(freq); var spectrum = fft.analyze(); noStroke(); fill(0,255,0); // spectrum is green for (var i = 0; i< spectrum.length; i++){ var x = map(i, 0, spectrum.length, 0, width); var h = -height + map(spectrum[i], 0, 255, height, 0); rect(x, height, width / spectrum.length, h ); } stroke(255); text('Freq: ' + round(freq)+'Hz', 10, 10); isMouseOverCanvas(); } // only play sound when mouse is over canvas function isMouseOverCanvas() { var mX = mouseX, mY = mouseY; if (mX > 0 && mX < width && mY < height && mY > 0) { osc.amp(0.5, 0.2); } else { osc.amp(0, 0.2); } }

classitems.description: Returns the amount of energy (volume) at a specific frequency, or the average amount of energy between two frequencies. Accepts Number(s) corresponding to frequency (in Hz), or a String corresponding to predefined frequency ranges ("bass", "lowMid", "mid", "highMid", "treble"). Returns a range between 0 (no energy/volume at that frequency) and 255 (maximum energy). NOTE: analyze() must be called prior to getEnergy(). Analyze() tells the FFT to analyze frequency data, and getEnergy() uses the results determine the value at a specific frequency or range of frequencies.
classitems.name: getEnergy

params.name: frequency1
params.description:
Will return a value representing
                              energy at this frequency. Alternately,
                              the strings "bass", "lowMid" "mid",
                              "highMid", and "treble" will return
                              predefined frequency ranges.

params.name: frequency2
params.description:
If a second frequency is given,
                              will return average amount of
                              energy that exists between the
                              two frequencies.

classitems.description: Constructor: new p5.SinOsc(). This creates a Sine Wave Oscillator and is equivalent to new p5.Oscillator('sine') or creating a p5.Oscillator and then calling its method setType('sine'). See p5.Oscillator for methods.

classitems.description:
Assign a parameter to be controlled by this envelope.
If a p5.Sound object is given, then the p5.Env will control its
output gain. If multiple inputs are provided, the env will
control all of them.

params.description:
A p5.sound object or

classitems.description:
Inspired by Simple Reverb by Jordan Santell
https://github.com/web-audio-components/simple-reverb/blob/master/index.js
 
Utility function for building an impulse response
based on the module parameters.
Internally, the p5.Convolver uses the a Web Audio Convolver Node.
classitems.name: convolverNode

classitems.description:
Create a p5.Convolver. Accepts a path to a soundfile 
that will be used to generate an impulse response.
classitems.name: createConvolver
example: var cVerb, sound; function preload() { // We have both MP3 and OGG versions of all sound assets soundFormats('ogg', 'mp3'); // Try replacing 'bx-spring' with other soundfiles like // 'concrete-tunnel' 'small-plate' 'drum' 'beatbox' cVerb = createConvolver('assets/bx-spring.mp3'); // Try replacing 'Damscray_DancingTiger' with // 'beat', 'doorbell', lucky_dragons_-_power_melody' sound = loadSound('assets/Damscray_DancingTiger.mp3'); } function setup() { // disconnect from master output... sound.disconnect(); // ...and process with cVerb // so that we only hear the convolution cVerb.process(sound); sound.play(); }

classitems.description:
Private method to load a buffer as an Impulse Response,
assign it to the convolverNode, and add to the Array of .impulses.
Connect a source to the reverb, and assign reverb parameters.
classitems.name: process

params.name: src
params.description:
p5.sound / Web Audio object with a sound
                         output.

example: var cVerb, sound; function preload() { soundFormats('ogg', 'mp3'); cVerb = createConvolver('assets/concrete-tunnel.mp3'); sound = loadSound('assets/beat.mp3'); } function setup() { // disconnect from master output... sound.disconnect(); // ...and process with (i.e. connect to) cVerb // so that we only hear the convolution cVerb.process(sound); sound.play(); }

classitems.description: If you load multiple impulse files using the .addImpulse method, they will be stored as Objects in this Array. Toggle between them with the toggleImpulse(id) method.
classitems.name: impulses

classitems.description: Load and assign a new Impulse Response to the p5.Convolver. The impulse is added to the .impulses array. Previous impulses can be accessed with the .toggleImpulse(id) method.
classitems.name: addImpulse

classitems.description: Similar to .addImpulse, except that the .impulses Array is reset to save memory. A new .impulses array is created with this impulse as the only item.
classitems.name: resetImpulse

classitems.description:
If you have used .addImpulse() to add multiple impulses to a p5.Convolver, then you can use this method to toggle between the items in the .impulses Array. Accepts a parameter to identify which impulse you wish to use, identified either by its original filename (String) or by its position in the .impulses Array (Number).
You can access the objects in the .impulses Array directly. Each Object has two attributes: an .audioBuffer (type: Web Audio AudioBuffer) and a .name, a String that corresponds with the original filename.
classitems.name: toggleImpulse

params.name: id
params.description: Identify the impulse by its original filename (String), or by its position in the .impulses Array (Number).

from (radians) a1 to a2, where a2-a1 < pi/2.  The arc's radius is r.

Returns an object with four points, where x1,y1 and x4,y4 are the arc's
end points and x2,y2 and x3,y3 are the cubic bezier's control points.

This algorithm is based on the approach described in:
A. Riškus, "Approximation of a Cubic Bezier Curve by Circular Arcs and
Vice Versa," Information Technology and Control, 35(4), 2006 pp. 371-378.

This is the p5 instance constructor.

A p5 instance holds all the properties and methods related to
a p5 sketch.  It expects an incoming sketch closure and it can also
take an optional node parameter for attaching the generated p5 canvas
to a node.  The sketch closure takes the newly created p5 instance as
its sole argument and may optionally set preload(), setup(), and/or
draw() properties on it for running a sketch.

A p5 sketch can run in "global" or "instance" mode:
"global"   - all properties and methods are attached to the window
"instance" - all properties and methods are bound to this p5 object

Missing item type
Specifies the number of frames to be displayed every second. For example,
the function call frameRate(30) will attempt to refresh 30 times a second.
If the processor is not fast enough to maintain the specified rate, the
frame rate will not be achieved. Setting the frame rate within setup() is
recommended. The default rate is 60 frames per second.

This module defines the filters for use with image buffers.

This module is basically a collection of functions stored in an object
as opposed to modules. The functions are destructive, modifying
the passed in canvas rather than creating a copy.

Generally speaking users of this module will use the Filters.apply method
on a canvas to create an effect.

A number of functions are borrowed/adapted from
http://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/canvas/imagefilters/
or the java processing implementation.

Missing item type
Applys a filter function to a canvas.

The difference between this and the actual filter functions defined below
is that the filter functions generally modify the pixel buffer but do
not actually put that data back to the canvas (where it would actually
update what is visible). By contrast this method does make the changes
actually visible in the canvas.

The apply method is the method that callers of this module would generally
use. It has been separated from the actual filters to support an advanced
use case of creating a filter chain that executes without actually updating
the canvas in between everystep.

Missing item type Table Options

Generic class for handling tabular data, typically from a CSV, TSV, or other sort of spreadsheet file.

CSV files are comma separated values, often with the data in quotes. TSV files use tabs as separators, and usually don't bother with the quotes.

File names should end with .csv if they're comma separated.

A rough "spec" for CSV can be found here.

To load files, use the loadTable method.

To save tables to your computer, use the save method or the saveTable method.

Possible options include:
  • csv - parse the table as comma-separated values
  • tsv - parse the table as tab-separated values
  • header - this table has a header (title) row
